Key Messages:

One study evaluated the effects on mammals of retaining dead trees after uprooting. This study was in the USA.

COMMUNITY RESPONSE (0 STUDIES)
POPULATION RESPONSE (0 STUDIES)
BEHAVIOUR (1 STUDY)

Use (1 study): A replicated, controlled study in the USAÂ found that areas where trees were uprooted but left on site were used more by desert cottontails than were cleared areas.
